page.title: 05Farming.
page.content: Until the Enclosure Acts, Bailey Hill was common land. About 150 years ago it became enclosed and divided into small farms. Originally there was more farms than today. Some of the farms have Welsh name Blain-y-Cwm, Cwm-Gilla, Garth Farm and Gwernaffel Others very English names like Brookside, Woodhouse and Rookery. Ferny House used to be called Hendre Genau. The farming in this part of the country is pastoral with supportive feed crops _ grain, root crops and hay. Sheep do very well on these hills along with beef cattle. Farmers sell their sheep and cattle at Knigton Market and the Spring and Autumn Sales. Sometimes they buy at other markets like Welshpool. Veterinary services are available in Knighton.
